summary: Simon, re: ITLW being excited for lore
mainText: 'FYI there isn't any new lore in there, just a general reminder that lore is paused and slowly being built back up :)'

summary: Simon, re: joining friends
mainText:
'You can join your friend with a code they can generate.
In the future we will have friend lists, so you can easily join like that'

summary: Simon, re: InTheLittleWood asking if the Machinima post will be last blog before release
mainText:
'Oh, tomorrow is just a video, not a blog!
There will be a short lore update blog by the weekend, followed by a release TLDR blog with patch notes.'

summary: Simon, re: quests
mainText: 'No quests right now, all removed until we fix them up.'

summary: Simon, re: Chayzur asking if kill quests are in the game
mainText: 'No, removed from all prefabs for now; they had issues, and we will bring them back later.'

summary: Buddha, re: user asking how he feels about Hytale launching soon
mainText:
'I'm overwhelmed, emotional - but I think above all else - I'm so grateful. I'm grateful for the team's unbelievably hard work and passion, and SO grateful for the community. Even when the community was told "the game is cancelled", you never gave up. 
I can't wait until Jan 13 ‚ù§Ô∏è'

summary: Simon, re: user suggesting being able to attach YT videos to bug reports
mainText: 'You can put it in the description'

summary: Simon, re: Mogswamp preordering Hytale, waiting to try it
mainText: 'Thanks, Mogswamp! Hopefully, we don't take too long to get it just right :)'

summary: Simon, re: Hytale's menu resembling Half-Life
mainText: 'coincidence, but I love the Half-Life series, one of the first games I made maps in'

summary: Buddha, re: Hytale screenshot
mainText: 'Gamers... less than one week to go üò≠‚ù§Ô∏è'

summary: Hytale shares screenshot - 6 Days until Early Access
mainText:
'‚ú® 6 DAYS ‚ú® until Early Access release!! #Hytale'

(Screenshot of skeleton mage in green robes w/ green potions)

summary: Simon, re: old dagger dash
mainText: 'No idea where it is, will investigate after launch.'

summary: Simon, re: swing direction not being mouse-based
mainText: 'it's like that for now but might change / add options later, got too much going on to do some changes like this atm'

summary: Simon, re: cozy/mining/crafting/building gameplay
mainText: 'Been trying to find some time to record this aspect of the game! I was planning a long video, but maybe something short is good enough. No promises, doing my best atm'

summary: Simon, re: if he's nervous
mainText:
'Not nervous about something in particular; whatever issues we have, I know we can fix. It will just take time as they come, and I hope the community understands we will be very busy.

Excited about seeing what creative people do with the game, it offers a lot of options!

One thing I hope is that people are generally happy with how the game feels and see its long-term potential!'

summary: Propzie, re: Shield slot function
mainText:
'The shield item in Z slot is only active with compatible gear, so it's just stored there when holding something 2h, like the Mace. If you hold Z it brings up a radial menu.
A shield on its own or paired with compatible gear, like a sword, gives you a shield bash option on block.'

summary: Simon, re: user being fond of midnight releases
mainText: 'the team would not be haha'

summary: Simon, re: official launch time
mainText: 'We are still figuring this out and will give answers in the coming days!'

summary: Simon, re: user joking about not actually being able to report bugs since the game isn't out
mainText: 'TRUE, for now :P'

summary: Simon, re: user commenting on how small Simon's cursor is in the bug reporting video
mainText:
'It's not about the size of the cursor but about how you use it!
On a serious note, I have a 32-inch 4K monitor, so the cursor on video looks small. We will add cursor size options in the near future. Thanks for the feedback!'

summary: Propzie, re: Lynn asking how to attack with butt end of mace
mainText: 'Hold block with right click then left click while still blocking. You can time this so you can nearly press them at the same time. This is still all subject to change and balancing ofc; but it does feel pretty good right now!'

summary: Propzie, re: ITLW asking about arrows around cursor during combat
mainText: 'It's next swing direction! It's controllable by holding movement direction; so for this example Simon is holding "D" on the keyboard to tell the next swing to be a left to right swing. If you hold "S" to go backwards, you do an uppercut :)'

summary: Simon showcases bug reporting in-game
mainText:
'New feature: You can report bugs and give feedback in-game.'

(Video)

summary: Oscar, re: Fan Music creator explaining their music background
mainText:
'Thanks for your support:)
 And that's great you produce and compose. I love sharing ideas and techinques with fellow creators, I'd be interested in seeing your process for these tracks!'

summary: Buddha, re: Machinima video announcement
mainText: 'Cat Nodding Rapidly - GIF'

Its half broken right now, slowly fixing it up! We want to rework the entire thing in the future, its super old and was not maintained.'

'Hytale Machinima
Thursday 10 AM EST on Youtube'

summary: Slikey, re: Watch Together feature
mainText: 'I brought it up a bunch of times on our Discord - basically the problem is that this feature was based on a proprietary library that has been EOL for 4 years and not received any updates. We had to remove it due to a whole collection of security issues. We will look at this again in the future but currently it's mostly seen as a vanity feature that gets trumped by gameplay improvements.'

summary: Simon, re: Myne's joke about hoping Hytale is delayed to be more polished
mainText:
'Alternative timeline of delay:'

(A Difficult Update' Blog Post title - Image)

summary: Simon, re: if the team plans to have the game translated into every language
mainText:
's√≠'

(Yeah)

summary: Simon, re: Ocean content
mainText: 'not much to see (sea!) yet'

summary: Simon, re: inviting friends
mainText:
'Generate a code and share it with friends so they can join your game. 
It should work with no router configuration; if it doesn't, just follow a few easy steps.'

summary: Simon, re: Friends System
mainText: 'No friend list on launch, but we have a prototype in the works already - should be coming in the first few months hopefully'

summary: Simon, re: opening worlds to friends on Day One
mainText: 'yea'

summary: Simon, re: HP Bars
mainText: 'Added the ability for servers to turn off player HP bars.'

summary: Simon, re: PVP
mainText:
'Fixed knockback; balancing it a bit now, real quick, so don't expect proper balance at launch. 
Already feels way more fun / satisfying to PvP.

Will need to see if we can add soft collision in time; it is improbable, as we have 2 days before we prep the launch build for next week.'

(It was just added this morning :P)

summary: Slikey, re: user asking if the team will update the Hardware Requirements blog with Mac specs

summary: Simon, re: user joking about their purchase of Hytale costing $70
mainText: 'Mine cost a lot more üò≠'

summary: Simon, re: user's suggestion to do community surveys to determine what gets added soonest
mainText: 'Honestly, we got a massive list of "obvious" issues/updates we need to do ASAP, and then we will explore how we can have fun with future updates and involve the community along the way.'

summary: Simon reveals some team members are working on post-launch patches/updates

(Screenshot of two dinosaurs amongst the foliage of Zone 4 caves)

summary: Simon, re: user disliking Mojang's politician-style communication, preferring Simon's openness
mainText:
'Yeah well it's because I own the company/game and am financially free to do whatever I want thoughüòÖ
The only one that can "fire me" is the players by not playing the game!!'

summary: Slikey, re: if a item/energy/fluid transfer system exists in Hytale, or if the community should agree on one
mainText: 'You should somehow align on a standard - anything we would provide would fall short. Unless we actively use it for exploration / adventure, we'd just end up building something half-baked and you'd still end up rolling your own.'

summary: Simon, re: Prowl comparing Simon and Jeb's communication
mainText:
'To be fair to Jeb, he has responsibilities to a large company with shareholders and hundreds of employees depending on its decisions. Everything he says can be overanalyzed and turned into ‚Äúnews‚Äù by mainstream media.

As someone who also worked in the Minecraft community for 14+ years, I can say it takes a high tolerance for hate and harassment. I‚Äôve had to hire security multiple times and work with law enforcement more than once.

Transparency as a developer is a double-edged sword. You say something in good faith, and years later, you‚Äôre still being quoted even after you‚Äôve changed your mind. It‚Äôs a tricky balance.

Personally, I‚Äôd rather say ‚ÄúI changed my mind, let‚Äôs move on‚Äù and deal with the downsides üòõ'

summary: Thomas, re: mixing two hair tints
mainText: 'At launch this won't be possible to mix two hair tints unfortunately üò¢ But we are exploring tech to allow this in the future...‚ù§Ô∏è'

summary: Thomas, re: previous tweet
mainText: 'We will keep improving this this year, and adding more options.'

summary: Thomas, re: user wanting longer hairstyles
mainText: 'We would love that too!  but it's mostly a tech issue : long haircuts tend to clip with body and cosmetics of the player veryyyy badly when moving around. This is because we don't have the tech to make hair flow naturally and collide with body, yet.'

summary: Thomas, re: haircuts in Hytale
mainText: 'Trying to improve as many outdated haircuts as I can before release, I feel more like a hairdresser than a 3D artist today ‚úÇÔ∏èüíá #hytale'

summary: Slikey, re: answering questions in Prowl's stream chat

summary: Simon, re: user's concern that Hytale is pushing massive world gen
mainText:
'The examples given are not representative of the final product! Will provide more details later on - we are aiming to be gameplay first and foremost.

To give you some reassurance: I don't really like enormous mountains/cliffs. They need to be interesting with NPCs / caverns / prefabs  / POI and interesting gameplay design. The lead designer and I completely understand this issue and will make sure the world designers do as well!'

summary: Simon, re: taking risks with updates
mainText: 'I'm not afraid to launch the game, so updates are the least of my worries üòÖ'

summary: Simon, re: Flash saying everyone took launch day off of work

mainText: 'Will probably give numbers a few days or weeks after launch, I don‚Äôt want mainstream media to cause more hype üòÖ'

summary: Simon, re: user taking a whole week off
mainText: 'bruh'

summary: Simon gives statement on Hytale's status
mainText:
'Friendly reminder!

Interest in Hytale is growing exponentially right now, and I feel like I need to remind people that we only got the game 7 weeks ago and that we are launching an actual early access experience, with all the issues that come with it.

In the long run, we will be fine, but the next few weeks will be chaos. The team is fantastic. I am beyond happy with how things are going; they will make Hytale the dream game we always wanted it to be. I am 100% sure of it. Please give us some time to launch, patch and work towards that dream.

I suggest you don't take a day off work on launch day; we WILL have launch-day issues with the launcher, logins, downloads, and other areas that could go wrong.
Rest assured, once you have downloaded and logged in once, you can be offline without issue. 

We received far more pre-purchases than we expected, and we are doing our best to welcome everyone as soon as possible.'

summary: Polina, re: WorldGen V2 blog
mainText: 'check it out, it‚Äôs really worth a read!'

summary: Simon, re: user looking forward to world mods
mainText: 'Imagine you install 20+ world mods, and you end up having this super massive game to exploreüòÖ'

summary: Simon, re: modding
mainText:
'After launch, we will add an in-game mod browser so you can easily download or share your mods, and players can install them with a single click.
If you host the mod, people will automatically install it when they join you; no need to pre-install on their end.

Imagine this: You install a mod that adds a new world with 6+ zones and 100+ biomes, created by a community member, in a single click.
Then have your friend join you via a code (no server installation required), and they will see the new world you just installed. Ready to explore.

This is Hytale. Player experience is essential for mods to shine.'

summary: DevSlashNull, re: login issues on website
mainText: 'Hey! We're aware of some users that have had this issue, please open a ticket with support while we investigate. https://support.hytale.com'

summary: Simon, re: World Gen V2
mainText:
'Artists/Designers/Modders can create whole new worlds on Day 1 using World Gen V2.

For example, you could make a portal that leads to your world, dimension or whatever you want to create.
You can add prefabs, NPCs, blocks, items and much more.

You don't need to write any code. A strong team could deliver a new Hytale experience in just a few weeks.'

summary: Simon, re: user questioning if Hytale will pay fair wage to community members who apply for World Designer positions
mainText: 'I estimate starting salaries to be around $80K to $100K+ USD a year for this unique role.'
